from manim_voiceover import VoiceoverScene
from manim_voiceover.services.azure import AzureService

        self.set_speech_service(
            AzureService(
                voice="en-US-AriaNeural",
                style="newscast-casual",
                global_speed=1.15

        # Use a light gray background

        self.wait(0.5)

        # Scene 2: What is an Elliptic Curve?

        with self.voiceover(text="First, let's understand what an elliptic curve is. It's defined by a specific equation, usually in the form y² = x³ + ax + b.") as tracker:
            self.play(Write(equation), run_time=tracker.duration)
        self.wait()
        with self.voiceover(text="Here 'a' and 'b' are constants that determine the curve's shape. Look at this beautiful curve!") as tracker:
            self.play(Create(curve), run_time=tracker.duration)
        self.wait(0.5)

        # Scene 3: Point Addition
        self.play(FadeOut(equation), FadeOut(curve))
        curve = FunctionGraph(lambda x: np.sqrt(x**3 - x + 1), x_range=[-1.3, 2.5], color=BLUE_C).scale(0.8).move_to(ORIGIN)
        self.play(Create(curve))

        P = Dot(curve.point_from_proportion(0.2), color=RED)
        Q = Dot(curve.point_from_proportion(0.6), color=BLUE)
        P_label = Text("P", font_size=32, color=RED).next_to(P, DOWN)
        Q_label = Text("Q", font_size=32, color=BLUE).next_to(Q, UP)

        line = Line(P.get_center(), Q.get_center(), color=YELLOW)
        R_neg = Dot(curve.point_from_proportion(0.9), color=GREEN)
        R = Dot(curve.point_from_proportion(0.1), color=PURPLE)
        R_neg_label = Text("-R", font_size=32, color=GREEN).next_to(R_neg, UP)
        R_label = Text("R", font_size=32, color=PURPLE).next_to(R, DOWN)

        with self.voiceover(text="Now comes the fun part: point addition. Imagine we have two points on the curve, P and Q.") as tracker:
            self.play(FadeIn(P), FadeIn(Q), FadeIn(P_label), FadeIn(Q_label), run_time=tracker.duration)
        self.wait()

        with self.voiceover(text="We draw a line through them. It will intersect the curve at a third point.") as tracker:
            self.play(Create(line), FadeIn(R_neg), FadeIn(R_neg_label), run_time=tracker.duration)
        self.wait()

        with self.voiceover(text="We reflect that point across the x-axis to get our final point, R. This is how we add points on an elliptic curve: P + Q = R.") as tracker:
            self.play(FadeIn(R), FadeIn(R_label), run_time=tracker.duration)
        self.wait(0.5)

        # Scene 4: Scalar Multiplication
        self.play(FadeOut(P), FadeOut(Q), FadeOut(P_label), FadeOut(Q_label), 
                  FadeOut(line), FadeOut(R_neg), FadeOut(R), FadeOut(R_neg_label), FadeOut(R_label))

        P = Dot(curve.point_from_proportion(0.2), color=RED)
        P_label = Text("P", font_size=32, color=RED).next_to(P, DOWN)

        self.play(FadeIn(P), FadeIn(P_label))

        for i in range(2, 6):
            Q = Dot(curve.point_from_proportion(i * 0.15), color=BLUE)
            Q_label = Text(f"{i}P", font_size=32, color=BLUE).next_to(Q, UP)
            line = Line(P.get_center(), Q.get_center(), color=YELLOW).set_opacity(0.5)
            self.play(FadeIn(Q), FadeIn(Q_label), Create(line))
            self.wait(0.2) # Add a slight pause for better pacing

            # Briefly highlight the line used for addition
            self.play(line.animate.set_stroke(width=5), rate_func=there_and_back, run_time=0.5)

            P = Q
            P_label = Q_label

        with self.voiceover(text="We can also perform scalar multiplication. This means adding a point to itself multiple times.") as tracker:
            self.wait(tracker.duration)

        with self.voiceover(text="For example, 2P is simply P + P, 3P is P + P + P, and so on. See how the point jumps around the curve?") as tracker:
            self.wait(tracker.duration)

        # Scene 5: ECC in Cryptography
        self.play(FadeOut(P), FadeOut(P_label), FadeOut(line), FadeOut(Q), FadeOut(Q_label))

        # Create a lock icon using Manim shapes
        lock_outer = Rectangle(width=1.5, height=2, color=GREY).set_fill(GREY, opacity=1)
        lock_inner = Rectangle(width=0.5, height=0.8, color=GREY).set_fill(GREY, opacity=1).next_to(lock_outer, UP, buff=0.2)

        public_key = Text("Public Key", font_size=36, color=BLUE).move_to(2*RIGHT)

        with self.voiceover(text="So how is this used in cryptography? ECC uses these operations to create public and private keys.") as tracker:
            self.play(FadeIn(lock), run_time=tracker.duration)
        self.wait()
        with self.voiceover(text="Your private key is a secret number, while your public key is a point on the curve derived from your private key.") as tracker:
            self.play(FadeIn(private_key), FadeIn(public_key), run_time=tracker.duration)
        self.wait()
        with self.voiceover(text="It's nearly impossible to figure out the private key from the public key, making it very secure!") as tracker:
            self.wait(tracker.duration)

        # Outro
        self.play(FadeOut(lock), FadeOut(private_key), FadeOut(public_key))
        title = Text("Elliptic Curve Cryptography Explained!", font_size=48, color=BLACK).move_to(ORIGIN)

        with self.voiceover(text="And that's Elliptic Curve Cryptography in a nutshell!") as tracker:
            self.play(FadeIn(title), run_time=tracker.duration)
        self.wait()
